posts.name: Shaun
posts.cooked:
Good morning, all.

We have been fortunate enough to have been allocated a good sized space to host our team.

image 852×868 60.6 KB

image 852×868 60.6 KB

image 852×868 60.6 KB

This is a rough sketch of the workspace we will have. The grey area is a bit larger than a typical FRC half-field. The top right room will at this stage be a messy fabrication/storage room and the top left room will be our CNC machining and relevant storage room (there are big windows around that room, too, and scope for improved ventilation and improved electricity supply if needed.

What I am after is ideas for how to adapt the remaining space, and indeed make use of the half field space when not being used for a half field. Particularly I am interested in:

Storage ideas (both in the rooms and in the wider area), for everything from small bolts/nuts to typical FRC items (wheels, chassis parts, mechanisms (assembled and non), electrical, etc), to large extrusions and sheet metal/wood

Workbenches that can be moved as needed, and their composition and layout. This space will eventually be hosting FLL / FTC builds as well as general STEM/engineering challenges (think solar challenge, rocketry etc)

I’d love to see what you guys have done with similar (or smaller/bigger!) spaces so that we get it as close to right as possible on the first try (unlike our robots!)

Thanks so much
If I were you and it were possible I’d move the field area more to the right, as it is the passage is rather narrow and more contiguous space is better in my opinion.

posts.name: Shaun
posts.cooked:
Good shout!

image 829×856 58.5 KB

image 829×856 58.5 KB

image 829×856 58.5 KB

I’d love to see how people manage things like fasteners, belts/wheels and the other finiky things as well. I think we will probably use standard racks for extrusion and sheet so that probably answers itself, but I would also love to see how you do workspaces (benches, desk layouts etc)

posts.name: 4573 Lead Mentor & Drive Coach
posts.cooked:
If you have the ability, have your pit set up and stocked next to the field for practice fixing issues in a contained space. 118 has a belt organizer that is essentially a peg board which can go anywhere.

If you are trying to keep open space, have work benches fold down from the wall around the field so when the field is not being used you have extra space.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
Skeller:

118 has a belt organizer that is essentially a peg board which can go anywhere.

YES!

I still haven’t gotten around to implementing this in our build space, but 118’s belt wall is awesome!! Details on customizing the “pegs” for different belt lengths was also shared here.
